questions.question: She ………………………….. to be an architect.
questions.description: She is a singular subject. Hence we use does here. Note that we write 'does not want', not 'does not wants'.

questions.question: ……………………… forget to lock the door before you leave.
questions.description: The simple present is used in imperative sentences and in the simple present tense we make questions and negatives with do.

questions.question: ………………………… not waste any more time.
questions.description: The simple present is used in imperative sentences.

questions.question: She …………………………….with her parents.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts.

questions.question: He was a kind guy who never …………………………… his servants.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: She ……………………………….. him at once.
questions.description: When we say when something happened, we use the simple past.

questions.question: We ……………………………. a movie yesterday.
questions.description: We cannot use the present perfect tense with a past time expression.

questions.question: Heavy rains ……………………….. the town yesterday.
questions.description: When we say when something happened, we use the simple past.

questions.question: I …………………………. him twice before he went abroad.
questions.description: Either simple past or past perfect can be used here.

questions.question: I don’t remember where I ………………………………. my purse.
I ……………………………. a snake in the garden.
